name: Attack at EP-CYG-4
overview: Attack at EP-CYG-4 is a shoot 'em up video game created by Mike Edwards for the Atari 8-bit family and published by his company BRAM, Inc. in 1982. It allows two players to cooperatively control the action against a computer enemy, in a fashion similar to Synapse Software's Survivor, also released in 1982. EP-CYG-4 was the first of Edwards' game efforts, and its success led to the creation of Zombies, which was published by Electronic Arts as Realm of Impossibility.
